swfscAirDAS 0.0.0.9000

  • Reference

Check AirDAS file

Source: R/airdas_check.R
airdas_check.Rd

Check that AirDAS file has accepted formatting and values

airdas_check(
  file,
  file.type = "turtle",
  skip = 0,
  file.out = NULL,
  sp.codes = NULL,
  print.transect = TRUE
)

Arguments

file

filename(s) of one or more AirDAS files
file.type

character; indicates the program used to create file. Must be one of: "turtle", "caretta", "survey", or "phocoena" (case sensitive). Default is "turtle". Passed to airdas_read
skip

integer: see read_fwf. Default is 0. Passed to airdas_read
file.out

character; filename to which to write the error log. Should be a text or CSV file. Default is NULL
sp.codes

character; filename of .dat file from which to read accepted species codes. If NULL, default (internal) file will be used. Default is NULL
print.transect

logical; indicates if a table with all the transect numbers in the x should be printed using table. Default is TRUE

Value

A data frame with five columns that list information about errors found in the AirDAS files: the file name, line number, index (row number) from the airdas_read(file) data frame, 'ID' (pre-Data# columns from the DAS file), and description of the issue. This data frame is sorted by the 'Description' column. If there are multiple issues with the same line, the issue descriptions are concatenated together using paste(..., collapse = "; ")

If print.transect is TRUE, then the output of table(x$Data1[x$Event == "T"], useNA = "always"), where x is the output of airdas_read(file, ...) is printed

If file.out is not NULL, then the error log is also written to the file (e.g., a .txt or .csv file) specified by file.out

Details

The default (internal) sp.codes file is located at system.file("SpCodesAirDAS.dat", package = "swfscAirDAS").

This function checks that the following is true:

  • Event codes are one of the following: #, *, 1, A, C, E, O, P, R, s, S, t, T, V, W

  • The effort dot matches effort determined using T, R, O, and E events

  • There is an O event between each T event, and vice versa, i.e. the data does not start a new transect while still on a transect and does not end a transect when already not on a transect

  • A T or R event does not occur while already on effort

  • An E event does not occur while already off effort

  • When the file ends, the data must be off effort and not still on a transect (i.e. an O event must occurred more recently than a T event)

  • All Data# columns for non-C events are right-justified

  • NAs are allowed for all data values when off effort except: altitude, speed, species, and group size

  • The following events have NA (blank) Data# columns: *, R, E, O

  • For PHOCOENA data, all non-C events have NA (blank) Data6 and Data7 columns

  • Event/column pairs meet the following requirements:

ItemRequirement
Viewing conditionsMust be one of: e, g, p, o, or NA (blank). Not case sensitive
AltitudeCan be converted to a numeric value, and is not NA
SpeedCan be converted to a numeric value, and is not NA
HKRCharacters must consist of: n, h, k, r, or NA (blank). Not case sensitive; y is also accepted for PHOCOENA data
Percent overcastMust be a whole number between 0 and 100 (leading zeros are ok)
BeaufortMust be a whole number between 0 and 9
JellyfishMust be one of 0, 1, 2, or 3
Horizontal sunMust be one of 0:12 (leading zeros are ok)
Vertical sunMust be one of 0:4 (leading zeros are ok)
ObserversEach entry must be two characters, and no observer code can be used twice in the same P event
Sighting (mammal)Angle must be a whole number between -90 and 90 (leading zeros are ok)
Sighting (mammal)Group size must be a whole number between 1 and 5000 (leading zeros are ok)
Sighting (mammal)Species codes must be specified in sp.codes, and the first must not be NA
Sighting (mammal)Observer code must be exactly two characters, and one of the current observers as specified by the most recent P event
Sighting (mammal)Angle must be negative if sighting made by left observer, and positive if made by right observer
Sighting infoSpecies percentages can be converted to numeric values, and sum to 100
Sighting infoUnused columns (DateTime, Lat, Lon, and Data1-4) of a '1' event must be NA (blank)
Sighting infoEvery S code with multiple species has a 1 code immediately after it
Sighting infoFor every 1 code with n non-NA sighting percentages, the event before is an S event with n non-NA species codes
ResightAngle can be converted to a numeric value (leading zeros are ok)
ResightUnused resight columns (Data3-7) must be NA (blank)
Turtle sightingAngle must be a whole number between -90 and 90 (leading zeros are ok)
Turtle sightingGroup size must be a whole number between 1 and 10 (only included in CARETTA data; leading zeros are ok))
Turtle sightingSpecies code must be not NA and specified in sp.codes
Turtle sightingObserver code must be exactly two characters
Turtle sightingTurtle size must be a whole number between 1 and 9 (leading zeros are ok); one of s, m, l is also accepted for CARETTA data
Turtle sightingTravel direction must be a whole number between 0 and 360 (only included in TURTLE data; leading zeros are ok))
Turtle sightingTail visible must be one of y, n, u, or NA (blank). Case sensitive
Turtle sightingIn TURTLE data, the Data7 column must be NA (blank)

Outstanding questions/todo:

  • Check for valid fish ball/mola/jelly/crab pot codes in comments?

Examples

if (FALSE) {
y <- system.file("airdas_sample.das", package = "swfscAirDAS")
airdas_check(y)
}
